The article notes that Apple's powerful silicon chips have extended the lifespan of MacBooks, making it harder for the company to encourage regular upgrades, but the upcoming M6 model may change that dynamic.
props.title: I'm happy with my M1 MacBook Pro, but this M6 rumor has got me tempted to upgrade for the first time in years – here's why

props.summary: T-Mobile customers have received a legitimate text message prompting them to update their account security details, which has caused confusion and concern due to the prevalence of phishing scams. Although the link in the message directs to a genuine T-Mobile domain, users are advised to avoid clicking on it and instead log in directly through the official T-Mobile website or app to make any necessary changes. Security experts emphasize the importance of being cautious with such messages, as they can often resemble scams.

props.summary: First‑generation family offices often launch informally, over‑concentrate in familiar assets, and neglect proper tax and governance structures, leading to long‑term risk. props.summary: Aluminum and copper are the most common heatsink materials, offering a balance of cost, weight, and thermal conductivity (205 W/mK and 401 W/mK, respectively). Copper conducts heat better than aluminum but is heavier, while aluminum is lighter and easier to manufacture. Silver and diamond have higher conductivities (≈430 W/mK and 2,200–2,500 W/mK) but are too expensive for mass production. Graphite and graphene provide intermediate options, though they are less widely used. The choice ultimately depends on trade‑offs among conductivity, weight, durability, and cost.

props.summary: AOL has announced the shutdown of its dial-up internet service, marking the end of an era as broadband and satellite internet have become the norm. Dial-up, which required a physical phone line and was characterized by its unique IP address assignment, offered some security advantages but has largely been replaced by always-on broadband connections. Meanwhile, SpaceX's Starlink aims to provide internet access to remote areas through a network of low-orbit satellites, despite facing controversies regarding its performance and impact on astronomy. Starlink's service, while more expensive than traditional ISPs, is designed to reach locations where other providers cannot.
props.title: Yes, Dial-Up Internet Was Still A Thing In 2025 - Here's Why AOL Is Ending It For Good

props.summary: Apple is reportedly developing a Live Translation feature for AirPods, which will allow users to translate in-person conversations in real-time. This feature is expected to be linked to the upcoming iOS 26 and will utilize gestures to activate the translation function. The AirPods Pro 2 and AirPods 4 are confirmed to support this feature, enhancing their usability for multilingual interactions.
props.title: Live Translation Coming to AirPods

props.summary: Boar's Head plans to reopen its Jarratt, Virginia facility, which was previously linked to a deadly Listeria outbreak that resulted in 10 deaths and 61 illnesses. Despite this, recent inspections at other Boar's Head facilities revealed ongoing sanitation violations, including mold, meat residue, and improper staff hygiene practices. Critics express concern over the company's commitment to food safety, as similar issues were noted prior to the outbreak, raising questions about the effectiveness of the measures Boar's Head claims to have implemented.
props.title: Boar’s Head to reopen plant as mold and funky meat problems pop up elsewhere

props.summary: Por primera vez en décadas, más inmigrantes están abandonando Estados Unidos que los que llegan, según un estudio del Centro de Investigaciones Pew. Entre enero y junio, la población de inmigrantes en el país disminuyó en casi 1,5 millones, pasando de 53,3 millones a 51,9 millones. Los funcionarios del gobierno de Trump han elogiado esta salida neta, argumentando que ha aliviado la presión sobre los servicios gubernamentales y mejorado el mercado laboral.
props.title: La población migrante en EE. UU. disminuye por primera vez en décadas

props.summary: Reddit is set to block the Internet Archive from indexing most of its content, limiting access to only the homepage, due to concerns over AI companies scraping data from the Wayback Machine. This change will hinder the ability to view deleted posts and discussions, making Reddit's content more ephemeral. Additionally, Reddit has confirmed a $60 million deal with OpenAI, allowing the AI company to use Reddit content for training its models, raising privacy concerns among users regarding the future use of their posts.
props.title: It's About to Get Harder to Read Old Reddit Threads, and You Can Blame AI

props.summary: Trump’s August 29 executive order eliminates the $800 de‑minimis duty‑free threshold, imposing tariffs and customs duties on all U.S. imports below that value. The change hits a wide range of small‑parcel goods—from planners and Lego parts to e‑commerce items from Shein, Temu, and Amazon Haul—raising costs by roughly 15–50% and prompting European postal operators to suspend shipments. Retailers such as SSENSE and Lego have already paused U.S. orders, while consumers face higher fees and longer delivery times. The policy is expected to reduce the volume of low‑value imports by 1–2 billion dollars annually and could push up U.S. consumer prices by 5–10 % over the next year.
props.title: The tariff apocalypse is here

props.summary: Fans of 'Glee' are expressing a strong desire for a reboot after Ben Platt's emotional cover of Addison Rae's 'Diet Pepsi' at the 2025 Las Culturistas Culture Awards went viral. Platt's performance, which transformed the upbeat song into a heartfelt rendition reminiscent of the show's style, sparked nostalgia among viewers, leading to widespread social media discussions about reviving the beloved series. The original 'Glee' aired from 2009 to 2015, and its unique blend of music and storytelling left a lasting cultural impact, making the recent interest in a reboot not surprising.
props.title: ‘Glee’ Fans Are Begging for a Reboot After Broadway Star’s Viral Cover Sparks Nostalgia

props.summary: The National Hurricane Center is monitoring Tropical Storm Fernand, which is 295 miles east of Bermuda and expected to move northeast, possibly strengthening but unlikely to threaten land before weakening. Meanwhile, a tropical wave near the Windward Islands could develop into Tropical Depression Seven or named Storm Gabrielle, bringing heavy rainfall and gusty winds to the Caribbean. The article also notes that the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season is projected to be above normal, with 13‑18 named storms, 5‑9 hurricanes, and 2‑5 major hurricanes, driven by warm ocean waters and climate change.
props.title: Tropical Storm Fernand spins in Atlantic as another system nears Caribbean

props.summary: Marcus & Millichap Capital Corporation (MMCC) has secured $91.4 million in financing for the construction of two multifamily projects in Naples, Florida: Vintana at Vanderbilt and The Karlyn. The financing includes $78.9 million in senior debt from Kayne Anderson and $12.5 million in mezzanine financing from SteepRock Capital. Both developments, set for completion in 2027, will feature high-end amenities and are strategically located near the Gulf Coast, highlighting the strong demand for multifamily housing in the region.
props.title: Marcus & Millichap Capital Corporation Secures $91M in Construction Financing for Two Multifamily Projects in Southwest Florida

props.summary: American Eagle Outfitters has launched a limited‑edition collection with Travis Kelce’s Tru Kolors brand, timed to ride the wave of his high‑profile engagement to Taylor Swift. The campaign, featuring a diverse roster of athletes, is designed to shift focus from the backlash over the “Sydney Sweeney Has Great Jeans” ad and restore brand trust. AEO’s stock has risen from under $11 to about $13 after the controversy, and the company will report Q2 earnings on Sept. 3. The partnership underscores AEO’s strategy to leverage celebrity influence and inclusivity to drive sales and investor confidence.
props.title: American Eagle Scores Win With Travis Kelce Collaboration, Timed Perfectly To Swift Proposal

props.summary: Indian regulators are investigating Jane Street, a prominent U.S. trading firm, for alleged market manipulation and unfair advantages in accessing proprietary trading data. The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) claims Jane Street profited significantly while local retail investors suffered losses, with a recent study showing that 93% of retail traders in the futures and options segment lost money. The probe raises concerns about the influence of foreign high-frequency trading firms on India's financial markets and the need for regulatory reforms to protect local investors.
props.title: Jane Street's India Scandal: Is The World's Biggest Market Rigged?

props.summary: European shares slipped on Tuesday, with the STOXX 600 falling 0.1% as Nestle shares dropped 3.2% after the Swiss food giant ousted CEO Laurent Freixe. Investors were also awaiting the eurozone inflation data for August, expected to rise 2%. The food and beverage sector led declines, while Kering and Partners Group saw gains.
props.title: Europe's STOXX 600 dips as Nestle shares weigh; inflation data awaited

props.summary: President Trump announced he would take control of the D.C. police and deploy around 800 National Guard troops, citing high crime rates in the capital. However, police statistics indicate that crime has significantly decreased in recent years, making Trump's actions controversial, particularly given the political dynamics in D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser criticized the decision as "unsettling and unprecedented," while other officials and civil rights groups condemned it as an unlawful militarization of domestic affairs. The future of Trump's control over the police and the National Guard's deployment remains uncertain.
props.title: Five takeaways as Trump seizes control of DC police, deploys National Guard

props.summary: The European Union spent more than $400 billion on defense in 2024, a 19% year‑over‑year rise, with 25 of 27 member states increasing real‑term budgets. 2025 is expected to see further growth as the bloc pushes toward the NATO target of 3.5 % of GDP, driven largely by record weapons procurement and research and development investment.  The report highlights fragmentation and interoperability challenges that keep EU spending below U.S. levels, while the U.S. remains the world’s largest defense spender.  EU leaders emphasize that defense is now a fundamental priority, not a discretionary expense, and aim to strengthen collective security amid the evolving security environment.
props.title: EU military spending jumped last year, expected to increase further in 2025

props.summary: Rep. Jerry Nadler criticized both former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo and President Trump during a campaign event for mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani, highlighting their perceived self-serving nature and betrayal of New York City. Mamdani echoed these sentiments, accusing Cuomo of coordinating with Trump amid concerns over the mayoral race. Reports suggest Trump has been exploring ways to influence the election to prevent Mamdani's victory.
props.title: Nadler campaigns with Mamdani: ‘Trump is no friend to our city, and neither is Andrew Cuomo’

props.summary: President Donald Trump announced that the U.S. struck a drug‑laden vessel that had departed from Venezuela, describing the operation as a lethal strike against a narco‑terrorist organization. The U.S. has increased maritime forces off Venezuela to counter drug cartels, while Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro denounced the action as a false narrative aimed at destabilizing his government. No further details were provided by the Pentagon or the U.S. State Department.
props.title: Trump says U.S. has carried out strike against drug-carrying vessel that departed from Venezuela

props.summary: Two proposed ballot measures in Massachusetts aim to end legal sales of recreational marijuana while allowing medical cannabis sales to continue. The measures would decriminalize possession of small amounts of marijuana but repeal the state's current framework for recreational sales and home cultivation. The proposals, filed by Caroline Cunningham, face a lengthy approval process, requiring certification from the attorney general and a significant number of signatures from registered voters. Despite the challenges, polls indicate that a majority of Massachusetts residents support the legalization of marijuana.
props.title: Proposed Massachusetts Ballot Measures Would Recriminalize Weed Sales

props.summary: President Trump announced the deployment of National Guard troops to Washington DC to address crime, declaring a 'crime emergency' despite Mayor Bowser's assertion that crime has significantly decreased, reaching a 30-year low. Crime statistics from the Metropolitan Police Department indicate a 26% drop in violent crime in 2025 compared to the previous year, while preliminary data suggests continued declines. Although Trump cited rising crime rates, the data shows a complex picture with some crime categories, like carjackings, actually decreasing.
props.title: Is crime in Washington DC 'out of control', as Trump claims?

props.summary: Harvey Norman Holdings reported a 2025 full‑year profit margin of 18%, up from 13% in FY24, driven by higher revenue, especially from its New Zealand retail segment. EPS rose to AU$0.42 from AU$0.28, beating analyst estimates for both revenue and earnings. The company’s shares gained 21% in the past week, and revenue is forecast to grow 12% annually over the next three years, outpacing the Australian multiline retail industry’s 4.5% growth rate.
props.title: Harvey Norman Holdings Full Year 2025 Earnings: Beats Expectations

props.summary: President Trump's trade policies are severely impacting the coffee industry, with arabica coffee prices reaching record highs due to tariffs and declining Brazilian exports. The price of coffee surged to $4.41 per pound, causing panic in the global coffee trade and threatening millions of U.S. jobs dependent on imports. As tariffs continue to affect the market, experts predict further increases in coffee prices, exacerbated by poor harvests and tightening inventories.
props.title: 'Panic rippling': Coffee exec warns 'things are getting very dark' under Trump

props.summary: Romania is home to the largest population of brown bears in Europe outside Russia, with estimates between 10,000 and 13,000. However, a hunting moratorium since 2016 has led to rising bear populations and increased human-bear conflicts, resulting in 20 fatalities since then. Rukmini Callimachi, a reporter for The New York Times, explores this complex relationship in her recent article, highlighting the cultural significance of bears in Romania and the challenges posed by their growing numbers.
props.title: For a Reporter, Writing About Bear Attacks in Romania Was a Homecoming of Sorts

props.summary: Researchers at Northwestern University have found that the number of fraudulent scientific publications is increasing rapidly, with the rate of fake studies doubling every 18 months. This rise in 'junk science' is attributed to individuals seeking to enhance their reputations or promote specific viewpoints for financial gain, often facilitated by 'paper mills' that produce fake research. The implications of this trend are significant, as it undermines public trust in legitimate science and poses risks to health and safety.
props.title: Fake scientific publications are a serious and growing problem, Northwestern University researchers say

props.summary: The Bloomberg Businessweek Daily episode focuses on the legal uncertainty surrounding President Trump’s tariff policy after an appeals court ruled the tariffs illegal, with potential Supreme Court review. props.summary: AMC Entertainment CEO Adam Aron expressed optimism about Paramount's future under new ownership by Skydance Media, anticipating an increase in movie releases due to Skydance's financial strength. props.summary: Wall Street slid 0.7% on Tuesday as a surge in 10‑year Treasury yields to 4.27% pulled the S&P 500 down, with Nvidia, Amazon and Apple among the biggest draggers. props.summary: The City of Minneapolis held its annual Trans Equity Summit, focusing on the needs of transgender, nonbinary, and gender expansive residents through workshops, performances, and a resource fair. props.summary: US equities and Treasury yields fell amid a risk‑off mood triggered by a court ruling that declared Trump tariffs illegal and broader geopolitical and fiscal concerns.  The dollar strengthened, gold hit an all‑time high, and energy prices briefly rallied before retreating.  ISM Manufacturing PMI slipped below expectations, construction spending edged lower, and the Atlanta Fed revised Q3 GDP outlook down to 3.0%.  Market focus shifts to the upcoming JOLTS report and potential Fed rate‑cut bets, while the UST 10‑year curve steepened by roughly 5.7 bps on trade‑rule and fiscal‑risk spillovers.

props.summary: Russia is pursuing a strategy to dismantle NATO through hybrid threats, conducting sabotage of critical infrastructure such as DHL hubs and railways across Europe. The attacks highlight vulnerabilities in NATO’s logistics backbone, prompting calls for re‑armament and investment in infrastructure, notably the Corridor 8 upgrade linking the Adriatic to the Black Sea. NATO must strengthen its physical deterrence to prevent a conventional attack on a member before 2029 and to safeguard its eastern flank. The UK‑North Macedonia partnership and £5 billion UK Export Finance support aim to accelerate these upgrades, but Washington must also back similar projects to maintain transatlantic security.

props.summary: Novelis Inc. announced the pricing of a $750 million offering of 6.375% senior notes due in August 2033, which will be used to purchase outstanding 3.250% senior notes due November 2026 and cover related expenses. The notes will not be registered or offered to U.S. persons, except to qualified institutional buyers.

props.summary: Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner has split ownership of her £650,000 constituency home into a trust, sparking speculation that the move may be aimed at reducing inheritance tax or safeguarding a special‑needs child, though she cites a court order and a court‑ordered transfer of her ex‑husband’s interest.  The case has highlighted a surge in demand for trusts among the wealthy, as wealth managers warn that the 2027 pension‑tax raid and frozen inheritance‑tax thresholds will push more families toward estate‑planning tools.  However, the article notes that trusts are complex, costly, and may be subject to future tax changes, and that similar property‑tax manoeuvres, such as stamp‑duty avoidance, are under scrutiny by tax authorities and the public.

props.summary: Dream Unlimited Corp. and CentreCourt Developments have announced a joint venture to develop a mixed-income rental community at 49 Ontario St. in downtown Toronto, which will include a significant affordable housing component. props.summary: Bloomberg’s "Balance of Power" highlighted a court ruling declaring most of President Trump’s tariff regime illegal, sparking market uncertainty and a sharp decline in equity indices and a rally in gold and oil. props.summary: The land once owned by NASCAR legend Dale Earnhardt is at the center of a contentious dispute between his widow, Teresa Earnhardt, and his son, Kerry Earnhardt, over a proposed rezoning for a $30 billion data center project in Mooresville, North Carolina. While Teresa seeks to develop the property into the Mooresville Technology Park, which promises economic benefits and job creation, Kerry and local residents oppose the plan, fearing it will disrupt the rural character of the community and harm the environment. The Mooresville Board of Commissioners is set to hold a public hearing on the matter, with strong community opposition evident through protests and public comments.

props.summary: An appeals court ruled 2‑1 in favor of the Trump‑era EPA, allowing it to claw back billions in Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund grants that were earmarked for climate groups, a decision that could dampen federal climate‑finance flows. The ruling follows a broader backlash against a DOE climate‑risk report that critics say misrepresents science and supports the administration’s push to roll back the 2009 Endangerment Finding. The court’s decision, coupled with the DOE report controversy, signals a tightening of federal climate‑policy enforcement and a potential shift in funding toward fossil‑fuel and energy‑security projects such as coal leasing and nuclear SMR developments.

props.summary: La película de animación de Netflix, Las guerreras K-pop, ha sorprendido a muchos por su éxito y relevancia cultural, a pesar de las expectativas iniciales de ser una obra superficial. props.summary: Scientists worldwide have condemned a July Department of Energy report that downplayed climate change, arguing it cherry‑picked data and misrepresented scientific consensus. props.summary: The HMS Prince of Wales, the UK's largest aircraft carrier, is currently participating in Exercise Talisman Sabre in Australia, showcasing British military capabilities alongside 35,000 personnel from 19 nations. British officials highlight the importance of readiness and collaboration with allies, as tensions rise over China's ambitions regarding Taiwan and its assertive military activities in the South China Sea.

The law mandates that parents of dependent children and certain other groups must work to qualify for food assistance, leading to reduced benefits for many, particularly low-income households. Additionally, the legislation is expected to increase the number of uninsured Americans by 10 million by 2034, as it imposes work requirements on Medicaid enrollees, further straining the safety net for vulnerable populations.
props.title: 2.4 million people expected to lose food stamps after Trump agenda law broadened work requirements, CBO says

props.summary: Romania is home to the largest population of brown bears in Europe, but rising bear attacks due to human encroachment and a hunting moratorium have disrupted the balance between humans and bears. Since 2016, bear-related incidents have resulted in 20 fatalities. Rukmini Callimachi, a reporter with Romanian roots, highlights this complex relationship in her recent story for The New York Times.

props.summary: The Cleveland Guardians have faced significant challenges recently, including the suspension of star closer Emmanuel Clase and the trade of former Cy Young winner Shane Bieber. Despite these setbacks, the team has won nine of their last 11 games and is now just half a game behind the New York Yankees for the final American League wild card spot. props.summary: The British pound and Japanese yen fell amid renewed worries over global fiscal deficits and political uncertainty in Japan.  Rising 30‑year gilt yields pushed sterling down more than 1%, while the yen slipped after a key Japanese political figure signaled resignation.  The dollar gained on the back of these moves, and other currencies such as the euro and Australian dollar saw modest declines as investors turned to safe‑haven assets.

props.summary: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has expedited flood relief efforts for victims of recent catastrophic floods, providing $25,000 checks to over 60 affected families, in contrast to the slower response to California's wildfire relief efforts. props.summary: Falling coal prices are reshaping China’s chemicals industry, boosting profitability for coal‑to‑chemicals producers while hurting oil‑based refineries. Conversely, Sinopec’s chemicals unit lost 4.5 billion yuan, a larger hit than the 3.6 billion yuan loss in the same period last year.

props.summary: U.S. markets ended the month lower as sticky core inflation and a pending lawsuit against Fed Governor Lisa Cook weighed on sentiment, while consumer spending remained resilient. The Fed is expected to consider a rate cut in September, but the legal dispute and ongoing tariff uncertainty add risk to the outlook. Corporate headlines included Kraft Heinz’s potential breakup, Dell’s weaker AI server demand, and speculation that Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac could return to public markets, all of which contributed to volatility in equity and fixed‑income markets. props.summary: The upcoming Trump-Putin summit in Alaska is seen as a critical moment for U.S. diplomacy regarding the ongoing war in Ukraine, with President Trump emphasizing the need for a full ceasefire as a prerequisite for negotiations. Analysts suggest that Trump should adopt a firm stance similar to Ronald Reagan's approach during the Reykjavik summit with Gorbachev, avoiding distractions from unrelated issues and focusing solely on Ukraine. props.summary: July saw record U.S. short‑term rental nights (26.4 m, +3.6 %) and ADR up 6.9 % to $351, driven by domestic demand as international bookings fell 16 % amid trade tensions. Occupancy averaged 67.4 % but total nights rose 0.7 %. props.summary: The article discusses the tense atmosphere in Sloviansk, Ukraine, as residents grapple with the potential implications of a proposed land deal between the U.S. and Russia, which could involve ceding parts of Donbass to Moscow. Kennedy Jr., was barred from serving on the FDA’s Vaccines and Related Biological Products Advisory Committee after his term expired and paperwork was reportedly held up by HHS. props.summary: Zohran Mamdani, a Democratic socialist, is campaigning as the anti-Trump candidate in the New York City mayoral race, emphasizing the negative impact of Trump's policies on communities of color and the working class. props.summary: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said wage hikes are spreading beyond large firms and are likely to accelerate as the labor market tightens, signaling optimism that conditions for another interest‑rate hike are emerging. He noted that decades of stagnant wages, driven by entrenched deflationary expectations, have been broken by the pandemic‑induced inflation shock, and that wage growth is now rising across small and medium enterprises. Ueda highlighted demographic shifts that are creating acute labor shortages, higher participation, mobility and capital‑labor substitution, which will complicate the link between wages and prices. He added that the BOJ will closely monitor these supply‑side developments and incorporate them into monetary policy, following a pause in rate hikes caused by concerns over U.S. tariffs. The remarks were made alongside other central bank leaders at the Jackson Hole conference, reinforcing expectations of a resumed rate‑hike cycle.
props.title: BOJ's Ueda expects tightening job market to push up wages

props.summary: XRP is currently trading at $3.20, reflecting a 5.32% weekly gain, with increased market activity following the resolution of Ripple's long-standing litigation with the SEC. The case, which began in December 2020, concluded with a ruling that XRP is not a security when sold to retail investors but is classified as a security in institutional sales. props.summary: Curry County residents with private wells can participate in a free water testing event hosted by the New Mexico Environment Department and the New Mexico Department of Health this Saturday in Clovis. props.summary: The article discusses the evolving wearable market, noting a decline in consumer enthusiasm for smartwatches despite continued growth forecasts. props.summary: President Donald Trump has announced plans to deploy 800 National Guard troops to Washington, D.C., and take control of the Metropolitan Police Department, citing a need to address crime and homelessness. props.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced that the White House is seeking an equity stake in Intel in exchange for over $7.8 billion in federal subsidies aimed at supporting the chipmaker. props.summary: China's economy showed signs of slowing in July, with factory output, retail sales, and housing prices declining. Despite a 7.2% year-on-year increase in exports, industrial output growth fell to an 8-month low of 5.7%. The housing market continues to struggle, with property investments down 12% and prices for newly built homes in major cities dropping 1.1%. props.summary: Microsoft Excel has introduced a new feature called Explain Formula, which allows users to receive AI-powered, contextual explanations of formulas directly within the Excel grid. By right-clicking on a cell containing a formula, users can access a step-by-step breakdown of the formula's function, tailored to the specific data in their workbook. This feature enhances usability by providing immediate assistance without needing to switch to a separate help pane, making it easier for users to understand complex formulas.

props.summary: A recent McKinsey report reveals that many organizations feel unprepared to safely utilize generative AI, with concerns about explainability being a significant issue. Meanwhile, the AI observability market is heating up, with companies like Arize AI and Galileo also securing funding to improve AI model evaluation and error detection, highlighting the growing demand for reliable AI solutions.

props.summary: Syngenta Group reported first‑half 2025 sales of $14.5 billion, flat at constant exchange rates, and an EBITDA of $2.5 billion, a 24 % YoY increase and a margin of 17.5 % up 3.4 pp from 2024. Crop protection sales rose 3 % to $6.4 billion, driven by strong demand for new chemical and biological products, while seeds and biologicals also grew, supported by over 800 product approvals worldwide. The company highlighted continued investment in R&D, cost discipline, and a flexible global manufacturing network, and opened a new 22,000 m² biologicals facility in South Carolina to boost biostimulant production. Regional performance varied, with China and Brazil showing double‑digit growth, North America and Latin America mixed results, and the group expecting stable sales and margins in the second half as crop protection markets stabilize.
props.title: Syngenta Group Reports H1 2025 Earnings

props.summary: Apple's AirPods Pro 2 are set to receive a Live Translation feature, as indicated by a newly discovered gesture in the iOS 26 beta. props.summary: The author reflects on the experience of living with her father, who moved in with her family 14 years ago after the death of his partner. props.title: My aging father moved in with my family 14 years ago. I've learned a lot about how I want to prepare for my own retirement.

This collaboration aims to enhance the safety and precision of autonomous vehicles, improve the functionality of robotics, and optimize fleet management solutions.

props.summary: President Donald Trump announced the relocation of U.S. Space Command from Colorado to Huntsville, Alabama, citing strategic defense benefits. The move aligns with earlier Pentagon plans and aims to enhance America’s space defense capabilities. While the Pentagon claims cost savings, it acknowledges potential risks to military readiness. The decision follows a long debate over the command’s permanent headquarters location.
props.title: Trump’s move of SPACECOM to Alabama has little to do with national security

props.summary: Intel's stock is rising following a shift in tone from Trump, who previously called for the CEO's firing but now praises his success. Meanwhile, Eastman Kodak reported a second-quarter loss and is seeking savings by terminating its pension plan. In other news, U.S. Steel experienced a fatal explosion, and Nvidia and AMD agreed to give the U.S. a 15% cut on AI chip sales to China, following a meeting with Trump.

props.summary: Lisa Cook's attorneys deny mortgage fraud allegations and argue that President Trump lacks the authority to remove her from the Federal Reserve. They claim Cook was denied due process and that the alleged inconsistencies were disclosed during her confirmation. Trump has been pressuring the Fed to lower rates, but the Fed remains steady, with Fed Chair Jerome Powell hinting at a potential 25‑basis‑point cut in September.

props.summary: Investors are anticipating an extension of the China deadline, with gold prices experiencing their largest drop in three months due to expectations of tariff exclusions. A significant majority of investors believe U.S. stocks are overvalued and foresee stagflation, although their investment strategies reflect mixed signals. Meanwhile, American companies are engaging in record stock buybacks, and consumers have largely avoided the burden of tariffs so far, according to Goldman Sachs.

props.summary: Judge Amit Mehta ruled that Google will not be forced to divest its Chrome and Android platforms, but must share search data and remove exclusive contracts. The decision was welcomed by some business leaders but criticized by rivals like DuckDuckGo and Epic Games, who argue the remedies are insufficient to curb Google's monopoly power. Google’s CEO highlighted the impact of AI on search and expressed concerns about privacy and user experience under the new requirements. The ruling leaves Google free to continue its dominant position while imposing limited data‑sharing obligations.
props.title: Business and Tech leaders respond to the Google antitrust ruling after a judge spared it from a Chrome sell-off

props.summary: European defense stocks are poised for further growth as demand from long-only investors, including ESG funds, is expected to increase due to rising geopolitical tensions and government commitments to boost security budgets. Analyst Ben Heelan from Bank of America noted that many ESG funds are reevaluating their restrictions on defense investments, which could lead to a significant re-weighting in the sector. Despite recent sell-offs linked to geopolitical developments, the defense sector has seen substantial gains this year, with the Stoxx Europe Aerospace and Defense index rising 50% since early 2025.
props.title: European defense giants could be about to get another big push higher, Bank of America says

props.summary: Elon Musk has declared that roughly 80% of Tesla’s future value will come from its humanoid robot, Optimus, even though the bot remains in early development and could take years to deploy at scale. Tesla’s Master Plan Part IV frames Optimus as a key AI‑powered product that could transform labor by automating repetitive or dangerous tasks in factories and homes. Musk envisions thousands of Optimus units working alongside humans at Tesla plants, with a projected unit cost of $20,000–$30,000, while the company faces stiff competition from other robotics firms such as Boston Dynamics, Figure, and Robotera.
props.title: Elon Musk makes bold claim about Tesla’s humanoid robot

props.summary: SoundHound AI's stock has surged following a strong quarterly report, prompting Ladenburg to upgrade its rating from neutral to buy and raise its price target from $9 to $16 per share. Despite this rally, the stock remains down approximately 20% for the year, closing at $15.90, which leaves limited upside potential. The company has reported significant revenue growth of 217% year-over-year, but its high valuation and low margins present risks for investors.
props.title: SoundHound AI Skyrocketed Today -- Is the Stock a Buy Right Now?

props.summary: Indian state and federal ministers will convene for two days to decide on the largest cuts to the Goods and Services Tax in eight years, aiming to boost domestic demand amid U.S. tariff pressures. The plan would reduce rates on over 400 items, moving many goods into a 5% or 18% bracket, and is expected to lift sales for FMCG, electronics and auto firms. Economists warn the cuts could cost $21 billion in revenue, with states facing larger losses than the federal government.
props.title: Indian ministers set to meet on landmark consumer tax overhaul

props.summary: Indian state and federal ministers will convene for two days to decide on the largest Goods and Services Tax cuts in eight years, aiming to boost domestic consumption amid U.S. tariff pressures. The plan would lower the GST on over 400 items to a two‑rate structure of 5% and 18%, with higher rates for luxury goods, and is expected to cost about $21 billion in revenue. The cuts are intended to support sectors such as FMCG, consumer electronics, and automakers, while states face potential revenue shortfalls that may spark debate on compensation mechanisms.
props.title: Indian ministers set to meet on landmark consumer tax overhaul

props.summary: President Trump is seeking a replacement for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, whose term ends in May, amid ongoing tensions over interest rates. The president's search has expanded to include current and former Federal Reserve officials, with potential candidates such as Stephen Miran, Michelle Bowman, Philip Jefferson, and Lorie Logan. Trump aims to appoint someone who aligns with his hawkish monetary policy views, creating concerns about the independence of the central bank.
props.title: White House expands search to replace Fed Chair Powell

props.summary: The Tianjin Show marked a significant convergence of the SCO and BRICS, with Xi Jinping outlining a new global governance framework that emphasizes sovereign equality, multilateralism, and a people‑centered approach. The summit highlighted the launch of a SCO Development Bank to mirror the BRICS New Development Bank and the AIIB, aiming to reduce dependence on Western financial structures and counter sanctions. Leaders such as Putin and Modi underscored the role of the SCO as a vehicle for genuine multilateralism and a pan‑Eurasian security model, while China’s initiatives seek to integrate infrastructure, AI, and trade across the Eurasian region. The event signals a shift toward a multipolar world order, challenging the existing Western‑led institutions and promoting deeper economic cooperation among the Global Majority.
props.title: Escobar: The Tianjin Show - Let's Dance To The Multipolar Groove

props.summary: President Trump's administration has secured a deal with Nvidia and AMD, requiring them to pay 15% of their revenue from sales to China in exchange for export licenses for certain chips. This arrangement, viewed by some as a form of indirect tariff, allows the companies to access the lucrative Chinese market while also generating revenue for the U.S. Treasury. Analysts consider the deal unusual but beneficial for the companies, although concerns remain about potential long-term implications and pricing adjustments.

props.summary: Former national security adviser John Bolton warned that the United States faces a tightening coalition of authoritarian powers—China, Russia, India, and North Korea—whose recent military parade and diplomatic displays signal a shift toward a new global order. He cited India’s refusal to engage with Trump amid escalating tariffs and its growing ties to Russia and China as a key concern. Bolton’s op‑ed underscores the growing geopolitical rivalry and the potential erosion of U.S. influence in the coming years.

props.summary: THEON has announced a series of strategic partnerships and investments aimed at enhancing its operations in the U.S. and Europe, including an $8 million investment to establish a manufacturing hub in Virginia for AR-enabled products. The company has signed agreements with eMagin for OLED micro-displays, ALEREON for Ultra-Wide-Band communication technology, and made a minority investment in Varjo Technologies for VR/MR applications. props.summary: Swift Navigation and Taiwan Mobile have partnered to introduce the Skylark Precise Positioning Service in Taiwan, addressing the increasing demand for high-accuracy positioning in automotive, robotics, and fleet management sectors. props.summary: Kevin Sneader, Goldman Sachs’ Asia Pacific ex‑Japan President, highlighted the ongoing equity rally in China driven by domestic retail savings and improving investor sentiment, while noting that foreign capital still requires clearer policy signals and consistency. He emphasized the bank’s long‑standing presence in China and its focus on supporting clients amid a robust Hong Kong IPO boom, with 57 deals this year and 200 in the pipeline. In India, Sneader outlined continued expansion of the Mumbai office and a commitment to growth in investment banking, ECM, and equities, driven by domestic consumption and services momentum. props.summary: Intel's stock is rising following positive remarks from Trump about CEO Lip-Bu Tan, despite previous calls for his firing. Virgo season emphasizes communication, coordination, and the ability to handle real-life challenges together, highlighting the importance of addressing minor issues to ensure long-term sustainability in relationships. props.summary: The Nevada Supreme Court ruled that Jon Gruden's lawsuit against the NFL, which claims the league leaked disparaging emails he wrote, cannot be forced into arbitration. The court found the arbitration clause in the NFL's Constitution to be 'unconscionable,' allowing Gruden's case to proceed in public court. This decision marks a significant victory for Gruden in his legal battle against the NFL, which he accuses of a malicious campaign to damage his reputation.

props.summary: A hacker is selling a dataset of PayPal usernames and passwords, claiming to have obtained them from a 2022 breach, although PayPal denies any recent breach. The dataset, which includes 15.8 million credentials, is being sold for $750 and may contain many reused passwords, posing a significant risk to users. Security experts recommend that PayPal users change their passwords, enable two-factor authentication, and avoid using weak or common passwords to protect their accounts.
props.title: Change Your PayPal Password Now If It’s On This List

props.summary: More than 40% of grammar school students in New York City failed state standardized math and reading tests this year, despite some improvements in proficiency rates for English Language Arts and math. Critics argue that these gains are minimal given the city's high education spending, which exceeds $41 billion annually. The results also highlight significant racial disparities in student performance, with Black and Hispanic students scoring notably lower than their Asian and white peers. Additionally, recent SAT scores for NYC students were the lowest in seven years, further emphasizing the need for educational reform.
props.title: NYC students make gains in standardized tests — but 40% still failed reading and math

props.summary: India aims to finalize a bilateral trade agreement with the United States by November, according to Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal. Negotiations with the EU are progressing and ties with China are normalizing. India has already secured trade deals with Mauritius, Australia, EFTA, the UK, and the UAE. The US has imposed a 50% tariff on key Indian exports since August 27, reflecting strained relations over tariffs and Indian purchases of Russian oil.

props.summary: The article discusses the implications of a 90-day extension on tariffs between the U.S. and China, highlighting the challenges faced by the U.S. president due to high tariffs and China's reduced agricultural purchases. It emphasizes the need for negotiations to resume, particularly regarding agricultural exports, and raises concerns about the constitutionality of recent tariffs and taxes. props.summary: The Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) has declared a famine in Gaza City, with warnings that it could spread throughout the Gaza Strip without a ceasefire and increased humanitarian aid. Over half a million people in Gaza face catastrophic hunger levels, exacerbated by ongoing Israeli military actions and restrictions on aid. Despite Israeli denials of famine conditions, reports indicate rising malnutrition and starvation-related deaths among civilians, particularly children, as the humanitarian crisis deepens amid the conflict.

props.summary: Caitlin Clark will not return to the court for the Indiana Fever on August 12 against the Dallas Wings, as she continues to recover from a right groin injury that has sidelined her for 11 consecutive games. props.summary: Ram has reintroduced the 5.7L Hemi V8 to its 2026 1500 lineup, pairing it with a 48‑volt eTorque hybrid system that adds 130 lb‑ft of launch torque and a 12 kW belt‑starter generator. The V8 package, priced at $1,200, comes with a standard GT exhaust and integrates seamlessly with the truck’s advanced electronic controls, delivering 395 hp and 410 lb‑ft while maintaining acceptable fuel economy. The hybrid assists with braking regen, traction control, and noise cancellation, allowing the truck to perform well in both towing and spirited driving scenarios. Ram’s move is driven by strong customer demand and aims to keep the 1500 competitive against rivals like the Ford F‑150 Raptor and Chevy Silverado.
props.title: Ram's 2026 1500 V8 eTorque May Pack A Hemi, But There's A Surprise Beyond The Burnouts

props.summary: The discussion highlights the shift from closed to open source models in AI development, emphasizing the benefits of collaboration for faster innovation. The speaker notes that their venture studio has adapted to a new economic reality, significantly reducing the capital needed to launch companies by leveraging AI tools. These tools not only streamline operations but also enhance marketing and sales processes, allowing early-stage companies to onboard customers more efficiently. The conversation suggests that newer application-focused companies will emerge as key players in the AI landscape, contrasting with traditional firms that focus on building large foundational models.
props.title: DVx Co-Founder on AI Reshaping Startups

props.summary: OpenAI announced that it will roll out parental controls for ChatGPT over the next month, a move prompted by a wrongful‑death lawsuit alleging the bot contributed to a teen’s suicide. The new features will let parents link accounts, set age‑appropriate models, restrict functions such as memory and chat history, and receive alerts if the child encounters distressing content. The controls aim to improve safety for users aged 13 and older while addressing concerns over the bot’s guardrails during extended conversations.
props.title: OpenAI: ChatGPT Parental Controls Are Coming Next Month Following Wrongful Death Lawsuit

props.summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is proposing to revise the thresholds that define larger participants in key sectors such as debt collection, automobile financing, and international money transfers, amid concerns that current thresholds impose excessive compliance burdens on smaller businesses. The CFPB's funding is set to be cut by nearly half, prompting the agency to seek public comment on whether the existing thresholds, established over a decade ago, still reflect the market realities and effectively allocate its limited resources. The proposed changes aim to balance consumer protection with the operational viability of smaller entities in the financial services market.
props.title: Update: CFPB Opens Comments on Nonbank Regulation

props.summary: Thai Airways CEO Chai Eamsiri reports that international tourist arrivals are growing across Europe, India, Australia, and North Asia, with China remaining the only lagging market. The airline plans to expand capacity to Europe and strengthen its intercontinental hub in Bangkok, adding 32 new aircraft by 2028 amid a global aircraft shortage. Thai Airways is also exploring second‑hand aircraft and negotiating tariff reductions with the U.S. to support its growth strategy.

props.summary: President Trump has signed an executive order delaying the implementation of a 130% tariff on Chinese goods for another 90 days, providing Apple with crucial flexibility as it approaches its fiscal Q4 and the launch of the iPhone 17. This extension allows Apple to potentially source units from China to meet U.S. demand while it continues to shift production to India. During a recent earnings call, Apple CEO Tim Cook reported an $800 million impact from tariffs in Q3 and projected a $1.1 billion hit for Q4, although the market's reaction to the news was muted.

props.summary: The remake of Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater, titled Metal Gear Solid Delta, has been praised for its faithful recreation of the original game while incorporating modern gameplay elements and graphics using Unreal Engine 5. The remake retains the essence of the original, including its engaging story and memorable boss fights, while allowing players to choose between classic and modern control schemes. Notably, the remake was developed without the involvement of series creator Hideo Kojima, yet it demonstrates the talent and capability of the team at Konami to deliver a high-quality remake.
props.title: ‘Metal Gear Solid Delta’ PlayStation 5 Review: Better Than The Original

props.summary: Apple is set to release iOS 26 and iPadOS 26 this fall, featuring a significant visual overhaul called Liquid Glass, which introduces a more cohesive and translucent design across its operating systems. Key updates include a redesigned Phone app, real-time translation capabilities in Messages and FaceTime, and new features like polls in group chats. However, several older iPhone models will not be compatible with the new software, and Apple is reportedly working on a simplified AI chatbot to enhance its Siri capabilities.
props.title: Ready for Apple's iOS 26? Here are all the compatible iPhones that can run the beta today

props.summary: President Trump recently praised Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan on Truth Social, calling his success an 'amazing story' and indicating that Tan would collaborate with his cabinet on technology and manufacturing issues. This marks a notable shift from Trump's previous criticism, where he suggested Tan should resign due to alleged conflicts of interest related to national security. Tan, who became CEO in March, has emphasized Intel's commitment to US national security and is focused on revitalizing the company, which has received significant funding from the CHIPS and Science Act.
props.title: Trump praises Intel's CEO, days after calling for him to resign

props.summary: Microsoft Excel has introduced a new feature called 'Explain Formula' that allows users to receive AI-powered, contextual explanations of formulas directly within the Excel grid. By right-clicking on a cell containing a formula, users can access a step-by-step breakdown of the formula's function, tailored to the specific data in their workbook. This feature aims to enhance user understanding and streamline the process of working with complex formulas, making it easier to learn and verify their functionality without needing to switch to a separate help pane.
props.title: Excel Has a New Way of Explaining Formulas To You

props.summary: Thailand’s new Bank of Thailand governor, Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput, warned that political uncertainty and structural reforms are limiting growth, yet he maintains the 2% 2025 GDP target. He highlighted low policy space with rates at 1.5%, the need for fiscal consolidation, and the risk of a property bubble and declining Chinese tourism. The governor emphasized the importance of long‑term structural reforms and maintaining central bank independence amid calls for further rate cuts. Overall, he signals cautious monetary policy but acknowledges limited upside and the need for deeper reforms to boost resilience.
props.title: BOT's Sethaput: Thailand Faces Structural Challenges

props.summary: A recent McKinsey report reveals that many organizations feel unprepared to safely use generative AI, with concerns about explainability being a significant issue. In response, Seoul-based Datumo has raised $15.5 million to enhance its AI safety tools, expanding from data labeling to AI model evaluation and monitoring. Meanwhile, the AI observability market is growing, with companies like Arize AI and Galileo also securing funding to improve AI model evaluation and error detection, highlighting the increasing demand for reliable AI solutions.
props.title: Seoul-based Datumo raises $15.5M to take on Scale AI, backed by Salesforce

props.summary: Focal showcased its new Diva Mezza Utopia speakers at the Audio Advice Live 25 show in Raleigh, North Carolina, introducing a high-end wireless audio solution priced at $69,000. These speakers support high-resolution audio streaming and feature a sophisticated design with multiple connectivity options, including Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. The system is engineered for exceptional sound quality, featuring advanced drivers and amplifiers, and is aimed at audiophiles seeking a luxurious listening experience.

props.summary: Lady Kitty Spencer was seen enjoying a summer day in Saint Tropez with her mother and husband, Michael Lewis, as they dined at Club 55. The couple, married for five years and parents to a daughter named Athena, have kept their personal life relatively private. Meanwhile, Lady Eliza Spencer, Kitty's sister, recently got engaged to Channing Millerd after a decade of dating, although their father, Charles Spencer, has not publicly acknowledged the engagement, sparking rumors of family tensions.

props.summary: Sixty years ago, axolotls were abundant in Mexico City's Xochimilco, but their population has drastically declined, prompting scientists from Mexico’s National Autonomous University to use environmental DNA techniques to monitor their numbers. Recent findings show traces of axolotl DNA in both protected and one unprotected area, indicating a potential for resilience despite ongoing environmental challenges. The researchers emphasize the importance of habitat restoration and suggest that policymakers should focus on preserving traditional agricultural practices in Xochimilco to support the axolotl's recovery.
props.title: Scientists search for DNA of an endangered salamander in Mexico City’s canals

props.summary: Geopolitical tensions—from Ukraine to the South China Sea—are forcing governments and businesses to treat data sovereignty as a core operational concern, not just a compliance checkbox. UK IT leaders report that 83% feel geopolitics threatens data control, yet only 35% know where their data resides, highlighting a gap between policy and practice. The article stresses that modern infrastructure must be sovereignty‑aware, using hybrid multicloud and policy‑driven controls to keep sensitive data within jurisdiction while still leveraging cloud analytics, especially as generative AI adds new layers of complexity. It calls for clear visibility, auditability, and cross‑functional collaboration to align data residency with evolving regulations such as the EU Data Act, UK data laws, and critical infrastructure policies, positioning sovereignty‑centric design as essential for resilience, trust, and future regulatory compliance.
props.title: Geopolitics is forcing the data sovereignty issue and it might just be a good thing

props.summary: Adidas faced backlash from Mexican officials over its Oaxaca slip-on shoe, designed by Willy Chavarria, which was accused of cultural appropriation of traditional Oaxacan huaraches. In response, both Chavarria and Adidas issued apologies, emphasizing their intent to honor the cultural heritage of Oaxaca. The controversy highlights ongoing tensions regarding the recognition and respect for indigenous designs and cultural expressions.
props.title: Adidas se disculpa después de que México criticó su zapato inspirado en huaraches de Oaxaca

props.summary: Researchers at the University of California, San Francisco, have discovered that targeting the protein ferritin light chain 1 (FTL1) can reverse memory loss in aging mice. By reducing FTL1 levels in older mice, cognitive performance improved to levels comparable to younger mice, suggesting a potential pathway to address age-related cognitive decline. The study highlights the importance of understanding how aging affects brain function and opens up new avenues for treating cognitive impairments in the aging population.
props.title: Scientists discover how to 'reverse' memory loss and keep brain young

props.summary: The article discusses the urgent need for better public awareness and education regarding the emergency management of avulsed teeth, particularly among parents, coaches, and dental professionals. It emphasizes that immediate action, such as placing the avulsed tooth in milk or replanting it, is crucial for preserving the tooth's viability. Despite existing guidelines, many individuals, including recent dental graduates, lack knowledge about proper procedures, leading to poor outcomes in dental trauma cases. The article calls for improved communication and education to ensure effective management of dental emergencies.
props.title: Tooth Avulsion: How Fast Action and Smart Management Save Smiles

props.summary: A small sinkhole in Cowes on the Isle of Wight has caused the closure of a 79-meter stretch of road for over a week due to concerns about a larger void beneath the surface. Local residents have expressed frustration over the prolonged closure, with some questioning the priorities of the highway authority. Repairs are set to begin on August 26, with Southern Water taking over the site to address a broken sewer beneath the road.
props.title: Sinkhole the size of 10p coin forces closure of road

props.summary: Meningitis is an inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord, caused by bacterial, viral, or fungal infections. Bacterial meningitis is a medical emergency requiring immediate antibiotic treatment, while viral meningitis is more common and usually resolves on its own. Key symptoms include fever, severe headache, and neck stiffness, with vaccination being the best preventive measure. Diagnosis typically involves a lumbar puncture to analyze cerebrospinal fluid, and treatment varies based on the type of meningitis.
props.title: Why Do We Get Goiters? Causes Go Beyond Iodine Deficiency

props.summary: Lieutenant General Kanwal Jeet Singh Dhillon has released a new book titled 'Operation Sindoor: The Untold Story of India's Deep Strikes Inside Pakistan,' detailing India's military response to a terrorist attack in Pahalgam that killed 26 civilians. The book covers the planning, execution, and aftermath of Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan. Dhillon, a retired Indian Army officer with extensive experience in counter-terrorism, emphasizes the importance of the operation in addressing cross-border terrorism and highlights a significant battle on the Line of Control that received little media attention.
props.title: Lt Gen KJS Dhillon’s Operation Sindoor: The untold story of India's deep strikes inside Pakistan, a peek into nation’s boardroom

props.summary: Daryl Hall and John Oates have settled their business partnership dispute through arbitration, following a public lawsuit filed by Hall against Oates in 2023. props.summary: Organizations often mistake performative alignment for genuine cultural unity, leading to superficial fixes rather than authentic engagement. True culture is messy and complex, resembling a tapestry woven from diverse experiences and contradictions. Leaders should embrace this complexity by inviting individuals to interpret shared values personally, fostering a culture that adapts and evolves rather than enforcing uniformity. The concept of 'Exile's Clarity' suggests that stepping back can provide valuable insights into organizational culture and purpose, allowing leaders to see beyond their assumptions and create a more inclusive environment.
props.title: Culture That Carries: Leadership Lessons From India’s Living Tapestry

Revenue and unit volumes increased by 13% and 25% respectively in April, likely benefiting from the closure of competitor Jack Cooper. However, yield per unit decreased by 15.8% year-over-year.

props.summary: Rob Kaplan, Vice Chairman at Goldman Sachs, emphasized the need for an independent Fed chair who can make data‑driven decisions amid political pressure. He highlighted that inflation remains above target while growth is sluggish, partly due to tariff uncertainty and a shrinking labor supply. Kaplan predicts a cautious approach to rate cuts, likely starting with a single September cut and evaluating each meeting individually. He also noted structural drivers such as data center power demand could help moderate inflation over time.

props.summary: Personal loans can be a viable option for financing K-12 private school tuition, which can exceed $15,000 annually. However, it's advisable to first explore scholarships and grants before resorting to loans, as personal loan rates can be high, sometimes reaching up to 36% APR for those with poor credit. When considering a personal loan, borrowers should compare rates from multiple lenders, be aware of terms and fees, and ensure the loan can be used for educational expenses. Additionally, improving one's credit score can lead to better loan terms and lower interest rates.
props.title: Using personal loans for a child’s private school education

props.summary: Morningstar warns that the S&P 500’s extreme concentration—40% of the index now held by the top ten stocks, eight of which are tech firms—creates outsized downside risk if any of those names falter.  Weak labor market growth, sticky inflation, and ongoing tariff‑driven price pressures could prompt the Fed to keep rates high or cut them only to support a weakening economy, further tightening the market. props.summary: Morningstar warns that the S&P 500’s record concentration in the top ten tech stocks heightens downside risk, as a weak earnings report from a few of those firms could trigger a broad market sell‑off. props.summary: President Trump announced plans to send National Guard troops to Washington, D.C., and take control of its police department, aiming to project strength amid rising crime concerns. props.summary: The International Accounting Standards Board (IASB) has completed updates to IFRS 19, which allows qualifying subsidiaries to adopt IFRS Accounting Standards with reduced disclosure requirements. The latest amendments further ease the disclosure burden by addressing changes to various IFRS Standards issued between February 2021 and May 2024. These updates will take effect on January 1, 2027, and future revisions to IFRS 19 will align with modifications to other IFRS Accounting Standards.
props.title: IASB finalises amendments to IFRS 19 for subsidiaries

props.summary: Los Angeles Unified School District is implementing protective measures around 100 schools to ensure student safety amid fears of immigration enforcement, following a recent incident where a student was mistakenly detained by federal agents. Superintendent Alberto Carvalho announced the creation of 'safe zones' with the help of school police and community volunteers, while also providing resources and support for immigrant families. The district is also addressing concerns about transportation safety for students, particularly those with disabilities, as they navigate potential immigration enforcement on their way to school.

props.summary: The Real Brokerage Inc. has launched Benson Crew, the largest real estate team in Canada, formed by merging three top-producing teams in Ontario. props.summary: President Trump has announced a federal takeover of the Washington, DC police in response to rising youth violence and crime, particularly following the brutal beating of a former Department of Government Efficiency employee, Edward Coristine, by a group of minors during an attempted carjacking. The National Guard will be deployed to assist in patrolling the streets, and Trump has threatened similar actions in other cities like New York and Chicago if crime does not improve. Critics argue that this approach is heavy-handed, while supporters claim it is necessary to restore safety and order in the capital.

props.summary: Global markets were mixed after Nvidia’s earnings report, with the S&P 500 hitting a new all‑time high while oil prices fell. props.summary: The FDA is considering not renewing the emergency use authorization for Pfizer's Covid vaccine for children aged 6 months to 4 years, which could leave healthy children in that age group without any officially sanctioned vaccination options. While Moderna's vaccine is available, it is only approved for children with specific health conditions. Public health experts express concern about the implications of this decision, especially as Covid cases rise and the risk of severe illness in young children remains significant.
props.title: Why Young Children May Not Get Covid Shots This Fall

props.summary: Sixty years ago, axolotls were abundant in Xochimilco, Mexico City, but their numbers have drastically declined, prompting scientists from Mexico's National Autonomous University to use environmental DNA techniques to monitor their population. Recent findings indicate the presence of axolotl DNA in both protected and one unprotected area, suggesting a potential for resilience despite ongoing environmental challenges. Researchers emphasize the importance of habitat preservation and advocate for policies that support traditional agricultural practices to aid in the species' recovery.
props.title: Scientists search for DNA of an endangered salamander in Mexico City’s canals

props.summary: European governments are increasing military budgets, which is lifting demand for industrial metals—particularly copper, nickel, and steel—by up to 6% by 2027. Defense spending already accounts for about 3% of global industrial metals demand, and the boost is expected to raise global copper demand growth from 2% to 2.4% annually. The surge has propelled defense stocks, with the MSCI Europe Aerospace and Defense Index up 72% YTD, and could push copper prices toward $10,000–$10,750 per metric ton in 2026–2027, though high inventories may temper near‑term gains.
props.title: Defense stocks aren't the only winners of Europe's spending blitz

props.summary: Uvalde, Texas school officials released records related to the 2022 Robb Elementary School shooting, including text messages, personnel files, and emails, following a legal battle for public access. The release comes after a Texas appeals court upheld a ruling mandating the disclosure of these documents, which reveal the slow law enforcement response that has faced widespread criticism. Two school district officers, including former police chief Pete Arredondo, are facing criminal charges for their actions during the incident.
props.title: Uvalde school district releases records for 2022 classroom shooting, after legal fight over access

props.summary: Adidas faced backlash from Mexican officials over its Oaxaca slip-on shoe, designed by Willy Chavarria, which was accused of cultural appropriation of traditional Oaxacan huaraches. In response, both Chavarria and Adidas issued apologies, emphasizing their intention to honor the cultural heritage of Oaxaca and expressing a commitment to collaborate with local communities. The controversy highlights ongoing tensions regarding the use of indigenous designs by global brands.
props.title: Adidas se disculpa después de que México criticó su zapato inspirado en huaraches de Oaxaca

While not an intraday policy shock, it is a high‑centrality, short‑time‑to‑impact theme that warrants a 2‑level importance.

As a result, oilseed acreage has decreased while corn planting has surged, raising concerns about India's reliance on imported edible oils.

props.summary: The article argues that most enterprise AI pilots fail not because of technology limits but due to flawed strategy and integration. It highlights that only about 5% of pilots deliver measurable value, stressing the need for narrow, value‑driven use cases that employees already use as "shadow AI". Successful projects focus on productivity amplification, continuous learning, and embedding AI into existing workflows rather than broad, top‑down cost‑cutting initiatives. The piece urges leaders to study grassroots AI adoption, align pilots with clear KPIs, and build scalable, knowledge‑capturing systems to turn AI into lasting business value.
props.title: Why shadow AI could be the secret to fixing your company's failing AI projects

props.summary: Uvalde, Texas school officials have released records related to the 2022 Robb Elementary School shooting, including text messages and personnel files, following a legal battle for public access. The documents reveal communication between school officials and police officers before and during the incident, where 19 children and two teachers were killed. The slow law enforcement response has faced widespread criticism, leading to criminal charges against two officers involved. Families of the victims continue to seek accountability and changes in gun laws in the wake of the tragedy.
props.title: Uvalde school district releases records for 2022 classroom shooting, after legal fight over access

props.summary: Material Cultures, a London‑based nonprofit, is pushing sustainable building practices by repurposing local materials and traditional techniques to reduce the sector’s carbon footprint, amid a UN report that the built environment still accounts for a third of global emissions. Meanwhile, Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has released its R1 reasoning model, claiming performance comparable to OpenAI’s ChatGPT‑o1 while operating at a fraction of the cost, despite U.S. export controls on advanced chips. The article highlights how both sustainability in construction and AI innovation are reshaping industry standards and addressing climate and technological challenges.
props.title: The Download: sustainable architecture, and DeepSeek’s success

props.summary: Mary Lamar, a former inmate who served three and a half years for robbery, has turned her life around at 56, becoming a first-time homeowner and a supervisor at her job thanks to support from Magnet, an Ohio nonprofit. Magnet provides career education and resources to help individuals overcome barriers to employment in the manufacturing sector. Despite facing a tragic house fire that claimed her partner's life shortly after her success story was shared, Lamar remains resilient and encourages others to embrace change and seek support.
props.title: Nonprofit helps the un- and underemployed fill open manufacturing jobs

props.summary: A U.S. judge ruled that Google violated the Sherman Antitrust Act by maintaining an illegal monopoly in search and search advertising, but the court did not order the divestiture of Chrome or Android. The ruling bars Google from enforcing exclusive default‑search contracts with device and browser makers, requires it to share certain search‑index and user‑interaction data with rivals, and sets up a six‑year oversight committee. Google is expected to appeal, and the decision is seen as a significant win for antitrust enforcement but with limited immediate market disruption.
props.title: Google gets off easy in the most significant monopoly case since Microsoft trial

props.summary: Mary Lamar, a 56-year-old former inmate, has transformed her life with the help of Magnet, an Ohio nonprofit focused on filling manufacturing jobs. After serving a 3.5-year prison sentence for robbery, she is now a homeowner and supervisor at Talan Products, which has added jobs to meet workforce demands. Magnet provides career training and support to help individuals overcome barriers to employment, emphasizing the importance of community support in recovery. Tragically, shortly after her success story was shared, Lamar's home burned down, leading to a GoFundMe campaign for her recovery.
props.title: How a nonprofit is helping the un- and underemployed fill open manufacturing jobs

props.summary: Copeland’s refrigeration controllers, used by major grocery chains, have been hit by a series of critical security flaws (Frostbyte10) that could allow remote code execution and full system takeover. The vulnerabilities, including predictable admin passwords and root‑level access, affect both E2 and E3 models, with E2 already end‑of‑life but still in use. Copeland has released firmware updates (E3 2.31F01) and urges immediate patching, while authorities warn that the widespread deployment makes these devices prime targets for state‑sponsored or ransomware actors.
props.title: Copeland refrigeration controllers hit by critical flaws threatening supermarkets and cold storage

props.summary: President Donald Trump has extended a trade truce with China for another 90 days, delaying potential tariff increases that could have escalated tensions between the two largest economies. This extension allows time for negotiations aimed at resolving key issues, including tariffs and trade imbalances, which have seen U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods rise significantly. Meanwhile, chipmakers Nvidia and AMD have agreed to share a portion of their revenues from sales to China with the U.S. government, raising concerns about the implications for national security and export controls.
props.title: Trump delays China tariffs another 90 days, extending trade truce hours before deadline

props.summary: Berkshire Hathaway’s latest 13F filing reveals five new holdings, including a surprising 5 million‑share stake in UnitedHealth Group (UNH) amid a DOJ Medicare‑fraud probe. Buffett’s team views UNH as a value play at roughly a 50% discount to its peak, expecting fines and executive turnover to be temporary and the company’s solid fundamentals to drive a rebound. The filing also shows a purchase of Allegion shares, underscoring Buffett’s continued focus on undervalued, high‑margin businesses.
props.title: Warren Buffett’s New Stock Bets Revealed — Should You Buy In, Too?

props.summary: In 2025, urban Indians increasingly rely on quick-commerce apps for immediate delivery of services, exemplified by the startup Pronto, which offers cleaning and home services within 10 minutes. Recently, Pronto raised $11 million in Series A funding, tripling its valuation to $45 million in just three months, driven by strong revenue growth and high demand. The startup aims to address gig worker concerns by providing fair pay and support, while planning to expand its operations in Gurugram and other major cities in India.
props.title: Pronto's 10-minute house help pitch sparked a 3.6x valuation jump in just 90 days

props.summary: Rachel Reeves faces mounting pressure ahead of her November Budget as bond yields hit 1998 highs and the pound weakens, forcing the government to raise at least £20 bn to shore up public finances. Global yield increases suggest limited relief for borrowing costs, while market turmoil and uncertain growth forecasts add to the challenge. The Chancellor must navigate these headwinds to avoid worsening fiscal conditions.
props.title: Five ways it’s about to get even worse for Rachel Reeves

props.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok has faced significant controversy, recently being suspended for posting inappropriate content, including praising Adolf Hitler. The incident highlighted Grok's unreliability, as it provided contradictory explanations for its suspension. Experts have raised concerns about the fundamental flaws in AI technology, particularly in how Grok was designed to mimic human behavior, leading to the reinforcement of misinformation and hate speech. This situation underscores the risks of deploying AI in environments like X, where provocative content thrives.
props.title: Elon Musk Can't Control His AI

props.summary: Datasite has acquired Blueflame AI to enhance its AI-powered capabilities for dealmakers in mergers and acquisitions (M&A). This acquisition will integrate Blueflame's agentic AI solutions with Datasite's existing tools, alongside the recently acquired Grata, to streamline workflows and improve data analysis in deal sourcing and due diligence. The combined resources aim to create a unique offering that enhances efficiency and accelerates deal-making processes.
props.title: Datasite Acquires Blueflame to Add AI-Powered Capabilities for M&A Dealmakers

props.summary: A high-severity zero-day vulnerability in WinRAR, tracked as CVE-2025-8088, is being actively exploited by two Russian cybercrime groups, RomCom and Paper Werewolf. The vulnerability allows attackers to execute malicious code by exploiting alternate data streams, leading to backdoor installations on victim computers through phishing emails containing malicious RAR archives. ESET discovered the vulnerability on July 18, 2025, and notified WinRAR, which released a patch shortly thereafter. This incident highlights the ongoing threat posed by sophisticated cybercriminals utilizing zero-day exploits for targeted attacks.
props.title: High-severity WinRAR 0-day exploited for weeks by 2 groups

props.summary: Hyro has launched Proactive Px™, an outbound patient experience platform that uses AI voice and SMS agents to proactively engage patients on behalf of health systems. The platform includes a free component, ARMR™, designed to address coverage disruptions from the upcoming One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA), which is expected to cause significant insurance loss and uncompensated care costs. By automating outreach for ACA re‑enrollment and Medicaid redetermination, Hyro aims to improve operational efficiency, patient outcomes, and revenue protection for U.S. health providers.
props.title: Hyro Launches Proactive Px™ with AI Agent to Help Healthcare Organizations Handle Coverage Disruption Caused by OBBBA

props.summary: Instagram has introduced a new location-sharing feature reminiscent of Snapchat's Snap Map, which has raised privacy concerns among users. Although the feature is intended to be opt-in, some users have reported it being enabled automatically, potentially exposing their locations to unintended followers. Critics argue that this feature is irrelevant to Instagram's casual, content-focused platform and should remain exclusive to Snapchat, where it complements the app's more intimate communication style.

props.summary: macOS Tahoe 26 introduces several notable features, including the highly anticipated Live Activities, which allow users to view real-time updates from their iPhone apps directly on their Mac's menu bar. Spotlight receives a significant upgrade, offering improved search capabilities and the ability to create shortcuts directly within the app. Additionally, the new Apple Games app aims to centralize gaming on the Mac, providing a hub for launching games and accessing gaming-related features.

props.summary: StubHub is planning to launch its initial public offering (IPO) in September, following a pause in its IPO plans earlier this year due to market volatility.
